<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Get recurring payment by ClientRequestId"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"get"}
  path={"/receiver/recurring/payment/pix/clientRequestId/{clientRequestId}"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Get a Recurring Payment, using its ClientRequestId.

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

<ParamsDetails
  parameters={[{"name":"clientRequestId","description":"Client's unique ID for the payment to be retrieved.","schema":{"format":"uuid","type":"string"},"in":"path","required":true},{"name":"forceProviderUpdate","description":"Parameter used to force a status update of the payment, calling the provider's GET Payment API. By default, we already continuously poll the Payment for immediate payment initiations, but for scheduled payments, we only poll once a day in the days previous to the payment date. You can use this parameter if you want to check if a scheduled payment has been canceled, for example. If you send true, the request time will significantly increase. This parameter is optional,  the default value is false.","schema":{"type":"boolean"},"in":"query"}]}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

<RequestSchema
  title={"Body"}
  body={undefined}
>
  
</RequestSchema>
